newsitem.title: FINLAND: Helsinki seen starting flat, eyes on forestries.
newsitem.headline: Helsinki seen starting flat, eyes on forestries.

text.p: Shares were seen opening flat to slightly easier on Friday after U.S. blue chips fell overnight on rate hike jitters and Nokia ended a shade below its Helsinki close, brokers said.
"We'll be about flat or a bit lower today," one broker said.
Forestry shares would be in focus after a rally on Thursday, and after news that Enso was in talks to buy German paper maker Holtzmann, brokers said.
Ericsson's Q1 earnings report, due in the afternoon, would also be watched as a cue for Nokia, they said. Nokia's Q1 earnings are due for release on Tuesday.
"Banks could be interesting after a good result from Alandsbanken ... and as we start looking ahead to Merita's result," one broker said.
Alandsbanken on Friday morning reported first-quarter operating profit after credit losses up to 13.9 million markka from 11.2 million a year ago.
But brokers said that end-of-week mood as well as caution ahead of Nokia's result and a raft of key U.S. econmic indicators next week could dampen trade.
